senses.sense_definition: To suffer from or be oppressed by intense, uncomfortable heat.

examples.text: We had to <w>swelter</w> in the office all day because the air conditioning was broken.
The tourists continued to <w>swelter</w> in the midday sun while waiting for the bus.

senses.sense_definition: To sweat profusely due to high temperatures.

examples.text: The athletes began to <w>swelter</w> as soon as they started their warm-up exercises.
He started to <w>swelter</w> in his heavy wool coat.

senses.sense_definition: To overpower or cause to faint with heat.

examples.text: The intense summer sun seemed to <w>swelter</w> the cattle in the open field.
A heavy, humid atmosphere threatened to <w>swelter</w> anyone who ventured outside.

senses.sense_definition: A state of intense, oppressive heat.

examples.text: The afternoon <w>swelter</w> made it almost impossible to work in the garden.
They sought relief from the city <w>swelter</w> by driving to the coast.
